termination.text:
o Maternity leave to lady casual labourers as admissible to regular Group 'D' (erstwhile)
employees was to be allowed.
o 50% of the service rendered under temporary status would be counted for the purpose
of retirement benefits after their regularisation.
o After rendering three years' continuous service after conferment of temporary status,
the casual labourers would be treated on par with temporary (erstwhile) Group 'D'
employees for the purpose of contribution to the General Provident Fund, and would
also further be eligible for the grant of Festival Advance/Flood Advance on the same
conditions as are applicable to temporary erstwhile Group 'D' employees, provided
they furnish two sureties from permanent Government servants of their Department.
o Until they are regularized, they would be entitled to Productivity Linked Bonus/Adhoc
bonus only at the rates as applicable to casual labourers.

evidence.source_text:
termination of service for any reason or on their quitting service.
o Maternity leave to lady casual labourers as admissible to regular Group 'D' (erstwhile)
employees
